page.title: 17London Apprentice
page.content: A Mr. Barron,who was over 70,used to walk this way regularly.He travelled all the lanes by the boundaries.People think he lived at Mevagissey and may have been a parson.He talked about local history. The boy renowned as being the foundation of the name,was reputed to hsve been shipwrecked at Pentewan. He then walked up the valley and came to Mr.Sleep's Blacksmiths shop. The Blacksmith asked him his name.The boy didn't know so he was asked where he came from.'London'he replied.It was nothing new in those days for people not to know their ages or even names. Mr.Barren also said that in the days of tin steaming at Pentewan a huge wave drowned 27 men working there.
